long_desc.thetext: If somebody of core team is kind enough to include sl (SLOVENIAN) locale, i'am willing to maintain sl.po file's .

Francek,
thanks for the kind offer. My current understanding is that we're maintaining qooxdoo's .po files in a qooxdoo-contrib project, called "Translation" [1]. This covers both standard apps, as well as framework classes. You could then work on any of them (feedreader and framework being the interesting candidates).
To set you up for this, you would need commit rights for the qooxdoo-contrib repository, and for this in turn I guess you would need to sign a license agreement. I'll try and check the details after our release next week (we're just too busy right now).
If you feel this is all too much hassle, you might as well attach a one-shot sl.po file to this bug, but we'd rather prefer the other way, as we are interested in translators that will also be around for the next release, to make necessary adaptions :-).
Cheers, Thomas
[1] https://qooxdoo-contrib.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/qooxdoo-contrib/trunk/qooxdoo-contrib/Translation

Andreas,
can you get me up to speed concerning the procedures for new translators?!

(In reply to comment #3) > @Franček: please see my email for the next steps > > @Thomas: will try to hand over those tasks to you, providing you with more info > > For now I'll assign this enhancement to me, finishing or dispatching it once > the licensing issues are resolved.
Andreas
Just curious about a status of enhancement.
Cheers, Franček
Andreas tells me the licensing stuff has been done, so I'll take over this bug to get the technical side going.

Francek,
you know the "Translation" contrib project, and you are enabled to commit to it. I've also created a new subfolder "1.6" for the upcoming release. I've added "sl" to the list of framework locales, so you'll find a corresponding framework/sl.po file - happy editing :-).
If you feel like it, I can also add "sl" to one or more of the applications in 1.6. Just leave a comment on this bug.
Sorry, I was mislead by the title of this bug and botched the locale code for Slovenia. Corrected to "si" in contrib and trunk.
Nope, the original title got it right: The Slovenina ISO 639 *language* code ("sl") is unlike the ISO 3166 *country* code ("si"), thanks Francek. Reverting things back.

(In reply to comment #8) > Nope, the original title got it right: The Slovenina ISO 639 *language* code > ("sl") is unlike the ISO 3166 *country* code ("si"), thanks Francek. Reverting > things back.
Please change also config.json file

Hi Thomas
How often do you pull locale from qooxdoo-contrib to qooxdoo trunk ?

(In reply to comment #10) > Hi Thomas > > How often do you pull locale from qooxdoo-contrib to qooxdoo trunk ?
Usually, short (2-3 days) before a release. But I can do an in-between update if that helps.
I think this is sorted out. Re-open, or open fresh bugs for new issues.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
